title: What Andy Robertson did to provoke raging Ayoze Perez after Liverpool beat Leicester
text:
Ayoze Perez clashed with Andy Robertson after Liverpool beat Leicester (Picture: Getty)

Andy Robertson provoked Ayoze Perez after Liverpool’s dramatic Premier League win over Leicester, Brendan Rodgers has claimed.

Foxes summer signing Perez had to be held back from Scotland captain Robertson after the pair clashed at full-time at Anfield on Saturday.

Leicester appeared to be leaving the Premier League leaders with a point but James Milner scored a 95th-minute penalty to maintain the Reds’ perfect start to the season.

Following the match, the TV cameras showed Perez clashing with Robertson and being held back by Liverpool’s Milner, Adam Lallana and Virgil van Dijk and Leicester team-mate Jamie Vardy.

Perez had to be held back by his Leicester team-mates (Picture: Getty)

An incensed Perez continued to exchange words with a number of the Liverpool players as he walked down the tunnel, and Rodgers believes his player was provoked.

Asked to explain what angered Perez, Leicester manager Rodgers said: ‘According to the guys, at the final whistle Andy Robertson celebrated and pushed him.

‘He [Perez] probably didn’t expect [that]. He was obviously annoyed at that and it led to a bit of a melee. But it was nothing really.

Sadio Mane’s 40th-minute strike gave Liverpool the lead at Anfield but the in-form James Maddison equalised for Rodgers’ side in the second half.

With the game in stoppage time, Mane was felled by Marc Albrighton and Milner made no mistake from the spot to earn Liverpool a dramatic win.

Reacting to the 2-1 victory, Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp said: ‘It was a super game. We upped the tempo. The football we played was so important.

James Milner’s late penalty earned Liverpool a dramatic win (Picture: Getty)

‘Leicester’s goal really stopped us but then we wanted to go forwards. The penalty was obviously a penalty.

‘We knew it would probably happen, we knew we were going to fight for the win – and we did.

‘Without luck, we cannot win the amount of games we have won, but over the 90 minutes we deserved it – we deserved the three points.’
